metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16841 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Samba from version 4.3.0 and before versions 4.7.12, 4.8.7 and 4.9.3 are vulnerable to a denial of service. When configured to accept smart-card authentication, Samba's KDC will call talloc_free() twice on the same memory if the principal in a validly signed certificate does not match the principal in the AS-REQ. This is only possible after authentication with a trusted certificate. talloc is robust against further corruption from a double-free with talloc_free() and directly calls abort(), terminating the KDC process.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16841` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.5
libnss-winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.5
libpam-winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.5
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.5
libsmbclient - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.5
libwbclient0 - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.5
python-samba - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.5
registry-tools - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.5
samba - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.5
samba-common - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.5
samba-common-bin - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.5
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.5
samba-libs - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.5
samba-testsuite - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.5
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.5
smbclient - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.5
winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.5').
